title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 10 June 2013 - XWiki
content:
<abusenius> has quit  
01:22 <chalx> has quit  
02:34 <kstuart> has quit  
04:13 <npm> has quit  
04:49 <npm> has joined #xwiki  
06:39 <SvenDowideit> has quit  
06:43 <SvenDowideit> has joined #xwiki  
07:35 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
07:36 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
07:59 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
08:31 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
08:52 <vmassol> good morning  
08:58 <vmassol> today is release day for 5.1M2  
08:58 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
08:59 <vmassol> are we all ready?  
08:59 <vmassol> tmortagne: I was saying: "good morning. today is release day for 5.1M2. are we all ready?"  
08:59 <vmassol> any dev who need to commit something before the M2 release?  
09:00 <tmortagne> vmassol: ok for me, I have things for 5.1 in general but nobody blocking the M2  
09:00 <tmortagne> s/nobody/nothing/  
09:00 <vmassol> mflorea: ?  
09:02 <mflorea> I have one commit in the pipeline, vmassol did you fix the issue with the HTML in the logs? http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-webstandards/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-webstandards/2531/testReport/org.xwiki.test.webstandards.framework/DefaultValidationTest/Validating\_XHTML\_validity\_for\_\_space\_XWiki\_\_page\_AdminSheet\_executed\_with\_credentials\_Admin\_admin/  
09:02 <mflorea> looks like it has some side effects  
09:03 <vmassol> mflorea: yes I did fix it but it was minor anyway  
09:03 <vmassol> ah? what side effect?  
09:03 <mflorea> look at the webstandards tests  
09:04 <vmassol> this one is not fixed  
09:04 <vmassol> apaprently  
09:04 <vmassol> checking  
09:04 <mflorea> I'll check the ui-tests  
09:23 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
09:24 <vmassol> ok i can reproduce the HTML if I go to http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/AdminSheet debugging now  
09:40 <chalx> has joined #xwiki  
09:56 <vmassol> ok found the problem, fixing  
10:06 <vmassol> ok fixed  
10:11 <sburjan> tmortagne: ping  
10:11 <tmortagne> sburjan: pong  
10:12 <sburjan> tmortagne: regarding SOLR and the e-mail you replied on friday. I am testing SOLR a little bit, and I have attached a png image to Main.WebHome, but searching it does not show any results. Am I missing something ?  
10:13 <mflorea> sburjan: yes, search on jira  
10:15 <tmortagne> sburjan: https://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-8887  
10:15 <tmortagne> (on the phone)  
10:21 <vmassol> mflorea: did you see this (happended after your commit): http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/3965/consoleText ?  
10:22 <vmassol> would need to check /home/hudsonagent/hudson\_root/workspace/xwiki-platform/xwiki-platform-tools/xwiki-platform-tool-packager-plugin/target/it/package-simple/build.log for details.  
10:22 <vmassol> Caused by: java.net.URISyntaxException: Illegal character in path at index 67: http://repo.maven.apache.org/maven2/org/apache/lucene/lucene-core/${lucene.version}/lucene-core-${lucene.  
10:22 <vmassol> version}.pom  
10:23 <Denis> has quit  
10:23 <mflorea> I'll look into platform-web  
10:29 <sburjan> mflorea: it seems that I can't get anything from the SOLR search  
10:29 <sburjan> searching for "Sandbox.WebHome" does not show anything  
10:30 <mflorea> sburjan: do you have the text "Sandbox.WebHome" somewhere? Is the wiki indexed?  
10:32 <sburjan> mflorea: yes, I do have Sandbox.WebHome. Regarding the indexing, after switching to SOLR, I reindexed the entire farm and I got the "Index successfully complete." message  
10:32 <sburjan> also searching for "XWiki" shows up nothing. So I think my index is broken  
10:34 <mflorea> vmassol, tmortagne: can you please move your issues http://jira.xwiki.org/issues/?jql=Project%20in%20%28%22XWiki%20Commons%22%2C%20%22XWiki%20Rendering%22%2C%20%22XWiki%20Platform%22%2C%20%22XWiki%20Enterprise%22%2C%20%22XWiki%20Enterprise%20Manager%22%29%20and%20fixVersion%20in%20%28%225.1-milestone-2%22%29%20and%20resolution%20in%20%28%22Unresolved%22%29 . Thanks.  
10:34 <vmassol> mflorea: sure but I don't have any ;)  
10:34 <mflorea> yes you have, reported  
10:35 <mflorea> didn't you set the Fix for field?  
10:35 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:36 <vmassol> tmortagne: I'll let you handle http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-8911  
10:37 <mflorea> what do we do with Sergiu's issue? http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-8910  
10:37 <vmassol> remove fix for?  
10:37 <vmassol> I asked sergiu in comments  
10:37 <vmassol> but he hasn't replied  
10:38 <mflorea> it has one commit  
10:38 <mflorea> I'll remove the fix for  
10:38 <vmassol> yes but it wasn't fixing the issue according to manuel  
10:38 <mflorea> ok  
10:38 <vmassol> I don't know if the commit fixed anything  
10:39 <vmassol> I hope it didn't cause any regression though ;)  
10:39 <vmassol> (since apparently it removes the loading of attachment content which may have been there for a reason)  
10:39 <vmassol> https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/c35bfc270bdfc2b911a9b4d173bf008e985dc1c5  
10:41 <vmassol> tmortagne: isn't http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9174 done?  
10:41 <tmortagne> vmassol: no it's not, I moved it  
10:42 <vmassol> ok I thought I had seen commits  
10:42 <tmortagne> but most of what used to be directly called by velocity is now in a bacground thread with all the needed catches  
10:43 <vmassol> ok so it's been done partially but there remains some parts in a wiki page  
10:43 <tmortagne> vmassol: I did not touched velocity side, the change is that what velocity called cannot fail anymore  
10:43 <vmassol> ok  
10:44 <tmortagne> I want to ad support for several jobs first to do this properly  
10:44 <tmortagne> but that was not the priority for 5.1 (priority goes to automated indexing)  
10:47 <vmassol> ok  
10:56 <sburjan> tmortagne: I am not able to do anything to get results using SOLR.  
10:56 <sburjan> I stopped the wiki, deleted the solr dir, restarted  
10:57 <tmortagne> sburjan: do you have any related log ?  
10:57 <sburjan> tmortagne: nothing in the console  
10:58 <sburjan> I am on today's snapshot  
11:05 <tmortagne> sburjan: finishing something and will try to reproduce that but last time I tried I was able to search  
11:05 <tmortagne> sburjan: you tried with jetty/hsqldb distribution ?  
11:06 <sburjan> tmortagne, : yes, jetty+ HSQLDB XE  
11:07 <sburjan> I see my solr dir populated after starting the wiki ...  
11:07 <sburjan> I know for sure it was working before  
11:09 <sburjan> also tried to reindex the whole farm  
11:17 <tmortagne> sburjan: I think I reproduce  
11:18 <tmortagne> from what I can see the right information is given to the SOLR server so it seems to be a search issue and not an indexing one  
11:18 <tmortagne> debugging  
11:25 <tmortagne> sburjan:I think I found the issue, good catch  
11:25 <chalx> has quit  
11:25 <tmortagne> mflorea, vmassol: looks like most mandatory classes are resaved at each startup  
11:26 <tmortagne> sburjan: do you reproduce the same issue ?  
11:26 <tmortagne> XWiki.TranslationDocumentClass for example  
11:27 <sburjan> tmortagne: afaik on each wiki startup some of the pages are re-stved, like Watchlist, etc. Is this what you are talking about ?  
11:27 <tmortagne> sburjan: Watchlist is not very nice but normal and it's not a mandatory class but it's a lot less normal to have all mandatory classes resaved at each startup  
11:28 <tmortagne> try with XWiki.TranslationDocumentClass  
11:29 <vmassol> tmortagne: is this new?  
11:29 <vmassol> some regression we introduced?  
11:30 <tmortagne> vmassol: this is pretty new IMO  
11:30 <tmortagne> and it's very bad either way  
11:32 <sburjan> tmortagne: I saw about 8-10 pages updated on each startup, but I did not wrote down all the pages. Having an EventListener to listen on UpdatedDocument can reveal them  
11:32 <sburjan> at least this is how I did, discovered it by accident  
11:33 <sburjan> bbl, lunch  
11:55 <tmortagne> sburjan: search should be OK now  
12:03 <vmassol> tmortagne: are you looking into the mandatory classes updates at startup or do you want me to have a look?  
12:06 <vmassol> checking quickly  
12:11 <vmassol> FTR initializeMandatoryClasses is working fine  
12:15 <vmassol> fixing XWiki.WatchListJobClass  
12:16 <tmortagne> vmassol: I'm looking  
12:16 <vmassol> the problme is:         if (doc.getAuthorReference() == null) {  
12:16 <tmortagne> vmassol: no initializeMandatoryClasses is not working that fine s far as I can see  
12:16 <vmassol> in setWatchListCommonDocumentsFields  
12:17 <tmortagne> vmassol: for what I can see all the initializer using AbstractMandatoryDocumentInitializer#setClassDocumentFields have the issue  
12:17 <vmassol> I didn't see that  
12:18 <vmassol> but maybe  
12:18 <vmassol> what I know for sure  
12:18 <vmassol> is that WatchListJobManager has an issue  
12:18 <vmassol> in setWatchListCommonDocumentsFields  
12:18 <vmassol> well not that code directly  
12:18 <vmassol> but it checks for author ref  
12:18 <vmassol> and since it's null it sets needsUpsate to true  
12:19 <vmassol> checking DB now  
12:20 <tmortagne> it's the exact same issue in AbstractMandatoryDocumentInitializer#setClassDocumentFields  
12:20 <tmortagne> the author reference is null  
12:20 <tmortagne>         if (document.getAuthorReference() == null) {  
12:20 <tmortagne>             needsUpdate = true;  
12:20 <tmortagne>         }  
12:20 <vmassol> I know  
12:21 <vmassol> the author is Guest in the db  
12:21 <vmassol> but now we return null  
12:21 <tmortagne> no  
12:21 <tmortagne> it's not the same for mandatory classes  
12:21 <tmortagne> document.getCreatorReference() is not guest  
12:22 <vmassol> I'm pretty confident the issue is that we reutrn null now for guest user  
12:22 <vmassol> https://www.evernote.com/shard/s119/sh/e419a24e-ce84-42ad-9ca5-c591df84a544/859ae1c82175200469af04dbe26555d0  
12:22 <tmortagne> look at the code I pasted  
12:22 <tmortagne> we set the document author with the creator reference  
12:22 <vmassol> yes but I've stopped my wiki  
12:22 <tmortagne> and the creator reference is supperadmin  
12:22 <vmassol> and checked the db  
12:23 <vmassol> so it's guest in there  
12:23 <vmassol> and not superadmin  
12:23 <tmortagne> maybe for watchlist  
12:24 <tmortagne> again I 'm talking about AbstractMandatoryDocumentInitializer here  
12:24 <vmassol> let me check what it saves  
12:24 <vmassol> I'm just looking at watcjhlist ATM  
12:25 <tmortagne> vmassol: I just looked at wtahclist and it's doing the same thing, setting the creator  
12:26 <tmortagne> which is superdamin  
12:26 <vmassol> yep  
12:26 <tmortagne> so no it's not as simple as you saif  
12:26 <tmortagne> said  
12:26 <SvenDowideit> has quit  
12:26 <vmassol> I'm checking why it doesn't save correctly  
12:26 <tmortagne> it should no be null  
12:26 <vmassol> In the DB it's guest  
12:26 <vmassol> so it's normal that we get null  
12:26 <vmassol> what's not normal  
12:26 <vmassol> is why superadmin is not used in the saved doc  
12:27 <tmortagne> yes this is why I keep telling you, is not because we use null for guess that we have the issue...  
12:27 <vmassol> well it's also because of that  
12:27 <vmassol> because before  
12:27 <vmassol> we had not null  
12:27 <vmassol> when guest was used  
12:27 <vmassol> which means it didn't resave the docs at startup  
12:28 <tmortagne> and it still did not had the right author...  
12:28 <vmassol> yep  
12:28 <vmassol> probably  
12:29 <vmassol> ok found it I think  
12:29 <vmassol> yep that's it  
12:29 <vmassol> XWikiHibernateStore  
12:29 <vmassol> line 531  
12:29 <vmassol>                 doc.setAuthorReference(context.getUserReference());  
12:30 <vmassol> this overrides the author defined in the passed doc  
12:30 <vmassol> and context.getUserReference() returns null  
12:31 <tmortagne> this does no make any sense, it would mean we can't choose the author  
12:31 <vmassol> dones by sd   
12:31 <vmassol> sergiu  
12:31 <vmassol> XWIKI-8240  
12:31 <tmortagne> this is not hibernate storage job...  
12:31 <vmassol> so 4.4.RC1  
12:32 <vmassol> well we could keep it  
12:32 <vmassol> but only if the user is not set  
12:32 <vmassol> as a fallback if the passed code doesn't set teh author  
12:32 <vmassol> now need to look at the issue that sergiu wanted to fix  
12:32 <tmortagne> IMO this has nothing to do in hibernate storage  
12:32 <vmassol> I think he fixed it in the wrong place indeed  
12:32 <vmassol> yep  
12:33 <vmassol> are you fixing it?  
12:33 <tmortagne> which mean ? reverting his commit ?  
12:34 <vmassol> reverting is not enough  
12:34 <vmassol> we also need to fix XWIKI-8240  
12:34 <vmassol> ie set the author before calling the store  
12:34 <vmassol> ie in rename() I think  
12:36 <tmortagne> probably  
12:36 <vmassol>         // Step 2: For each child document, update its parent reference.  
12:36 <vmassol>         if (childDocumentReferences != null) {  
12:36 <vmassol>                 XWikiDocument childDocument = xwiki.getDocument(childDocumentReference, context);  
12:36 <vmassol> so something like:  
12:37 <vmassol> childDocument.setAuthorReference(...)  
12:37 <tmortagne> yes  
12:37 <tmortagne> looking at it  
12:37 <tmortagne> creating a jira issue first  
12:37 <vmassol> same for backlinks docs below I think  
12:37 <vmassol> ok  
12:37 <vmassol>             XWikiDocument backlinkDocument = xwiki.getDocument(backlinkDocumentReference, context);  
12:37 <vmassol> backlinkDocument.setAuthorReference(...)  
12:40 <vmassol> tmortagne: checking jira, I think someone created some jiras about this recently...  
12:40 <vmassol> (or maybe I dreamt it)  
12:41 <tmortagne> don't remember it or it was very indirect side effect maybe  
12:41 <vmassol> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9010#  
12:42 <vmassol> could be related maybe  
12:42 <tmortagne> right, that one  
12:43 <tmortagne> it's possible  
12:43 <vmassol> the affects orrespond at least  
12:43 <tmortagne> at leas that's true for some of the listed classes  
12:43 <tmortagne> but some of them could have a different cause since they are not all mandatory classes  
12:44 <vmassol> yep but save will do that  
12:44 <vmassol> if there's no context user  
12:44 <vmassol> (or guest)  
12:44 <tmortagne> vmassol: it's possible some of these are really setting guest as author  
12:44 <vmassol> IMO it's more like we have some daemon threads not setting the author correctly  
12:45 <tmortagne> why daemon thread ?  
12:45 <tmortagne> I'm pretty sure it's at startup that's all  
12:45 <vmassol> because for the main thread we set the author  
12:45 <vmassol> yes startup is possible  
12:45 <vmassol> if it's done before we set the current author in the contetx  
12:46 <tmortagne> I'm pretty sure all that is node before we set the current user  
12:46 <vmassol> but it really means we have some code not setting the author as it should  
12:46 <vmassol> it would be good to have some warning in XHS  
12:46 <vmassol> when we save the doc  
12:46 <vmassol> if the author is null  
12:47 <vmassol> wdyt?  
12:47 <vmassol> (to find places where it's not set correctly)  
12:47 <vmassol> s/XHS/XWHS/  
12:47 <tmortagne> vmassol: not sure I understand, it's very possible this issue is all about XWIKI-8240 and having guest as author is not really an error  
12:48 <vmassol> 8240 is only about renae  
12:48 <vmassol> rename  
12:48 <vmassol> but more generally we can have problems if save doc is called and the author is not set  
12:48 <tmortagne> XWIKI-8240. is about forcing the saved document author to be the one in the context  
12:48 <tmortagne> which mean guest in most of theses classes cases  
12:48 <vmassol> for me 8240 was about what we deiscussed  
12:48 <vmassol> ie make the change in rename()  
12:48 <vmassol> ie set the author there  
12:49 <tmortagne> vmassol: I'm talking about what XWIKI-8240 introduced  
12:49 <tmortagne> the cause of the issue we are talking about  
12:49 <tmortagne> which is not that some code set the wrong author  
12:50 <vmassol> 8240 is fixed easily by changing rename()  
12:51 <vmassol> (and revert what sergiu has done)  
12:51 <tmortagne> I know  
12:51 <vmassol> now that doesn't ensure  
12:51 <tmortagne> again I talking about what sdmitriu did  
12:51 <vmassol> that all calls to saveDoc will have the author set correctly  
12:51 <vmassol> we could have some daemon thread or some init code that doesn't set the author  
12:51 <vmassol> and setting guest is wrong IMO  
12:52 <vmassol> hmm  
12:52 <vmassol> only for those cases though  
12:52 <tmortagne> yes but as I told you it's not an error to have guest being the author of a document  
12:52 <vmassol> it could be valid in other cases  
12:52 <tmortagne> yes  
12:52 <tmortagne> just give guest edit right  
12:52 <vmassol> so  
12:52 <vmassol> if the conetxt author is not set and author is guest maybe?  
12:52 <vmassol> hmm I guess we can't know that now  
12:52 <vmassol> :  
12:52 <vmassol> :(  
12:52 <vmassol> since we use null  
12:52 <vmassol> for both not set and guest  
12:53 <tmortagne> not set is guest  
12:53 <vmassol> which is why it's a anti pattern btw  
12:53 <vmassol> there's a difference between not set (ie bug) and set to guest voluntarily  
12:54 <vmassol> for example imagine that the scheduler job was not setting the author  
12:54 <vmassol> it would make changes as guest  
12:54 <vmassol> which wouldn't be correct  
12:54 <vmassol> I'm trying to find a way to find out these kind of issues  
12:54 <vmassol> but doesn't look easy....  
12:58 <vmassol> mflorea: fyi webstandards is fixed :)  
12:59 <vmassol> 9 jobs left to fix…. :(  
12:59 <mflorea> only 2  
12:59 <vmassol> 2?  
12:59 <mflorea> yes, for master  
12:59 <vmassol> for master ye  
12:59 <vmassol> yes  
13:00 <mflorea> selenium should be fine with my latest commits  
13:00 <mflorea> and I'm debugging ui-tests now  
13:00 <vmassol> I'm taking http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ldap-5.0.x/39/console  
13:00 <mflorea> ok, but it's not blocking for 5.1M2  
13:01 <vmassol> it's not but it's bad to have stable 5.x branch failing  
13:01 <mflorea> sure  
13:01 <vmassol> even worse than having master fialing  
13:01 <vmassol> :)  
13:06 <vmassol> hmm i don't get it, I've logged on a11 and built the ldap test module and it builds fine...  
13:06 <vmassol> anyway...  
13:06 <vmassol> trigging again  
13:07 <chalx> has joined #xwiki  
14:04 <mflorea> has quit  
14:13 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
14:20 <chalx> has quit  
14:36 <chalx> has joined #xwiki  
14:49 <vmassol> rrr platform 5.0 failing again  
14:55 <vmassol1> has joined #xwiki  
14:55 <vmassol> has quit  
14:56 <vmassol1> is now known as <vmassol>  
15:04 <sburjan> tmortagne: and idea if your fix is contained by a recent build ?  
15:05 <sburjan> about SOLR  
15:06 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
15:24 <tmortagne> sburjan: no idea, let me see  
15:24 <tmortagne> sburjan: note that you don't really need to wait, you can apply it yourself pretty easily since that's SOLR configuration actually  
15:25 <tmortagne> sburjan: in data you have a solr folder  
15:25 <tmortagne> apply https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/18b321aaa300b25379b2ad81ba78d07adaa8de77 to conf/schema.xml file  
15:26 <sburjan> thanks  
15:29 <sburjan> tmortagne: it seems that my file is already patched. SOLR is still not working for me  
15:29 <tmortagne> sburjan: it's an indexing issue so you need to resave whatever you are searching for  
15:30 <sburjan> I am trying to search stuff out of the box  
15:30 <tmortagne> now I'm not so sure actually that SOLR will change the shema without wiping it  
15:30 <sburjan> like sanbox, xwiki, etc  
15:30 <sburjan> \*sandbox  
15:30 <tmortagne> sburjan: as I said the bug is at indexing level so you need to reindex what you are searching for  
15:31 <sburjan> tmortagne: I reindexed the whole farm. Same result  
15:31 <tmortagne> according to the dates the last build should contain the commit  
15:32 <tmortagne> so you might try that to be safe  
15:32 <sburjan> yes I am already on the last one from maven.xwiki.org  
15:32 <tmortagne> and the generated schema.xml is right ?  
15:33 <sburjan> it's the vanilla one  
15:33 <tmortagne> does it contain the modification I pointed out ?  
15:33 <evalica> has quit  
15:33 <sburjan> yes  
15:34 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
15:34 <tmortagne> what are you search ?  
15:34 <tmortagne> searching  
15:34 <evalica> has quit  
15:34 <tmortagne> I tested with the content of a document I save right before searching  
15:34 <sburjan> tmortagne: I am searching for pages that are bundled in the package  
15:35 <tmortagne> what exactly are you searching
